sen.j: 小倉氏采地折紙寫并雑記（東京大学所蔵史料）によると「信吉 少名 酌 長丸 織田武蔵守 剃髪後号道ト」とされ、幼名は長丸であった可能性もある。
sen.e: In "Ogura-shi Saichi Origami Shahei Zakki" (memorandum record on the territorial certificates of the Ogura clan) (historical document owned by The University of Tokyo), it is written'Nobuyoshi, the name in his infancy, Shaku Chomaru (長丸), Oda Musashi no Kami (Governor of Musashi Province Oda), a pseudonym after tonsure, Doboku,' and therefore, it is possible that his childhood name was Chomaru (長丸).

sen.j: 本能寺の変後は母興雲院とともに小倉にて蟄居していたが、1583年に豊臣秀吉から召し出されて羽柴姓と武蔵守の官、近江国神崎郡高野村や犬上郡宇尾村に2000石の所領を賜り、羽柴武蔵守と名乗って高野に館を構えた。
sen.e: After the Honnoji Incident, he was place in confinement at home in Kokura with his mother Koun-in, however, in 1583 he was invited by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, and he was conferred the surname of 'Hashiba', official post as Governor of Musashi Province, and the territories producing a total stipend of 2,000-koku () crop yield in Takano-mura Village Kanzaki Country and Uo-mura Village Inugami Country in Omi Province.

sen.j: 『近江輿地志略』や『淡海温故録』によると禄高は2万石ともいうが、1599年12月、豊臣氏の大老から近江国内で2000石の所領安堵の朱印状を交付されており2000石が正しいと思われる。
sen.e: Although he had a stipend of 20,000-koku according to "Omi Yochi-shiryaku" (Summary of topography about Omi Province) and "Omi Onkoroku" (Record of old matters in Omi Province), he received Shuinjo (a vermilion seal letter) to provide the authorization for the ownership of lands with a 2,000-koku stipend in total and guarantee their feudal tenure from the chief retainer of Toyotomi clan, and therefore, the figure 2,000-koku seems to be correct.

sen.e: During the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600, he supported the West squad, joining Tamehiro HIRATSUKA's army with his smaller brother Nagatsugu ODA., and set out to the front with 500 soldiers as a defensive force for Yoshitsugu OTANI troops.

sen.e: In the main fight that took place on September 15, although the commander-in-chief Yoshitsugu and other military commanders of the West squad troops, including Tamehiro and Nagatsugu fought to death, Nobuyoshi succeeded in escaping from the front.
